general_advisory: As per the extended range forecast of IMD, MC, Bhubaneswar, dry weather is very likely to prevail over the districts of Odisha during week-1 (7th to 13th February, 2025) and minimum temperature is very likely to be normal to below normal over the districts of Coastal Odisha and districts adjoining Coastal Odisha and appreciably below normal over the remaining parts of the state during that period.

advisory: In transplanted rice, application of 35 kg urea per acre should be advised as first top dressing at 20-25 days after transplanting or maximum tillering stage.

In just transplanted field use 3 pheromone traps with 5mg lure/acre in the rice field for monitoring of the yellow stem borer and leaf folder. Whenever the number of male moths in trap reaches 4 or 5, spraying of Azadiractin 0.15% neem seed kernel based EC formulation @ 800 ml/acre should be advised.

If sucking insect attack is noticed in Green/Black gram field then farmers should use 8 nos. of yellow sticky trap per acre to control these insect at vegetative stage. At initial stage of attack, farmers should spray 5 ml neem oil per liter of water to control these insect.
To control yellow mosaic virus attack in field, spraying of imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.3 ml or thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 0.3-0.5 ml per liter of water should be advised.
Prevailing increasing temperature condition may accelerate the Mango Hopper attack in orchard so its regular monitoring should be advised.
Avoid irrigation at flowering stage to reduce flower drop in Mango orchard.
Wrap or fix polythene/alkathane sheet tightly on Mango trees to manage mango mealy bug.
To control leaf eating caterpillar and fruit borer/shoot and fruit borer in Tomato and Brinjal, spraying of Emamectin Benzoate @ 0.4 g per liter of water should be advised.
Regular monitoring against sucking insect attack (aphids, thrips etc.) should be advised. Avoid chemical application at flowering stage.
Looking to the increase in temperature in upcoming week, farmers are advised to increase the fresh clean drinking water supply to the animals. Avoid grazing of animal at noon hours.
Vaccination against FMF, HS, BQ etc. should be advised. Deworming of animals is advised to control harmful worm.
